title: Bitforms gallery
text:
bitforms gallery is a gallery in New York City devoted to <a href="new%20media">new media</a> art practices.
History.
Founded in 2001, bitforms gallery represents established, mid-career, and emerging artists critically engaged with new technologies. Spanning the history of media art through its current developments, the gallery’s program offers an incisive perspective on the fields of digital, internet, software-based, and new media art forms.
Supporting and advocating for the collection of ephemeral, time-based, and digital art works since its founding, bitforms gallery artists are in the collections of the <a href="Museum%20of%20Modern%20Art">Museum of Modern Art</a>, New York; <a href="Tate%20Modern">Tate Modern</a>, London; the <a href="Solomon%20R.%20Guggenheim%20Museum">Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum</a>, New York; the <a href="Smithsonian%20American%20Art%20Museum">Smithsonian American Art Museum</a>, Washington, D.C.; the <a href="National%20Portrait%20Gallery%20%28United%20States%29">National Portrait Gallery</a>, Washington, D.C.; <a href="Crystal%20Bridges%20Museum%20of%20American%20Art">Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art</a>, Bentonville; <a href="Center%20for%20Art%20and%20Media%20Karlsruhe">Center for Art and Media</a> (ZKM), Karlsruhe; <a href="Centre%20Pompidou">Centre Pompidou</a>, Paris; <a href="Victoria%20and%20Albert%20Museum">Victoria and Albert Museum</a>, London; <a href="Stedelijk%20Museum%20Amsterdam">Stedelijk Museum</a>, Amsterdam; and <a href="Borusan%20Contemporary">Borusan Contemporary</a>, Istanbul, among other institutions internationally.
In September 2014, bitforms gallery relocated from Chelsea to the Lower East Side in a ground-level storefront space on Allen Street.
